subject: RE: [junit] How to test a main(String[] args) method?
msgSnippet: Hi, ... - maybe mainly because I work successfully with mocks, this was the first idea I had. (I mainly mock complex remote communication partners, e.g. corba
messageBody:
Hi,

> Why do we prefer to create code when we can simply move the
> code we have?

- maybe mainly because I work successfully with mocks, this was the first
idea I had. (I mainly mock complex remote communication partners, e.g.
corba based proprietary servers, other proprietary servers with special
communication protocolls, DBs, ... . This works really good for me
and lets me tests lots of stuff in my unit tests)

- the code to be written is not complex

- you cannot simply move the code in this case because the calls to exit
are scattered around, you would also have to replace the exit calls
with e.g. return SomeExitCode;

Bernd
